reference.title: Generic Container Comparison & Examples
reference.shortdesc: HTML has two types of generic containers: inline (SPAN) and block-level (DIV). Examples of their different uses may help you choose the proper generic container.

row.entry:
Inline generic container
SPAN should be used to contain small sections of content that do not stand alone.
A single letter in a word, a single word in a sentence, or a single sentence in a paragraph.

Block-level generic container
DIV should be used to contain larger blocks or complete sections of content.
An entire paragraph, a section of a document.
